label: Mobile App Ordering & Customization
description: Personalized mobile ordering with visual customization and saved favorites delivering 35-50% higher order values and 90%+ accuracy through intuitive digital interfaces.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer stands at counter and verbally orders: 'Big Mac with no pickles, extra sauce'. 2. Cashier manually enters order with 10-15% error rate on customizations. 3. Customer repeats order for clarification. 4. Customer pays and waits in lobby for order. 5. No order history or personalization for repeat customers.
constraints: 10-15% order error rate from verbal miscommunication
No visual confirmation of customizations
Queue wait time 3-8 minutes during peak
No saved favorites or order history
Average ticket $8-12 without upsell
Counter interaction intimidates customization requests

agentic.workflow: 1. Mobile Ordering Agent loads customer's past orders and favorites for quick reorder. 2. Visual Customization Interface shows burger with toggles for toppings, sauces, and modifications. 3. Recommendation Engine suggests upsells based on order: 'Add fries and drink for $3 more (save $2)'. 4. Order Confirmation displays visual summary with all customizations clearly shown. 5. Customer schedules pickup time or curbside delivery, pays in app, bypasses counter completely.
benefits: 35-50% higher average ticket through upsell and bundling
Zero counter queue time (mobile order ahead)

quickWins: Launch mobile app with one-tap reorder of favorites
Implement visual burger builder with real-time preview

label: Kiosk Ordering Experience
description: Self-service kiosks with intuitive navigation and upsell optimization increasing order values 20-35% and reducing counter labor by 40-60% through automated ordering.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer waits in line for cashier availability (3-5 min wait during peak). 2. Cashier takes order verbally, manually enters into POS. 3. Cashier asks scripted upsell: 'Would you like to make that a combo?'. 4. Customer pays at counter and receives receipt. 5. One cashier handles 8-12 customers per hour.
constraints: Limited cashier throughput (8-12 orders/hour per station)
Inconsistent upsell execution (cashiers forget or feel awkward)
Labor cost $12-18/hour per cashier
Peak hour queues frustrate customers
Training required for new menu items and promotions
Language barriers create order errors

agentic.workflow: 1. Kiosk Interface greets customer with visual menu and current promotions. 2. Smart Navigation guides customer through categories with large product images and descriptions. 3. Upsell Engine automatically suggests combos and add-ons: 'Make it a meal for $2.50 more?' with one-tap acceptance. 4. Accessibility Features provide multi-language support, large text mode, voice assistance. 5. Payment processed via card tap/insert, order sent directly to kitchen with unique number for pickup.
dataSources: Digital menu with images and descriptions
benefits: 20-35% higher average ticket through automated upsell
18-25 orders per hour per kiosk (2x cashier throughput)
Customers report higher satisfaction (no line pressure)

quickWins: Deploy 2 kiosks per store to handle 40-50% of orders
Configure smart upsell for top 5 combo opportunities

label: Online Ordering & Delivery Integration
description: First-party web ordering with delivery partner integration capturing 15-25% higher margins vs third-party platforms while maintaining direct customer relationships.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer orders via DoorDash or Uber Eats (only delivery option). 2. Third-party platform takes 25-35% commission on order. 3. Customer data owned by delivery platform, not restaurant. 4. Brand can't market directly to customer or build loyalty. 5. Menu pricing marked up 15-20% to cover commission, hurting competitiveness.
constraints: 25-35% commission to delivery platforms erodes margins
Zero first-party customer data or relationship
Can't build loyalty or retarget customers
Menu pricing inflated to offset fees (customer pays more)
Inconsistent brand experience via third-party apps
Delivery issues blamed on restaurant despite platform fault

agentic.workflow: 1. First-Party Ordering Platform enables web and app orders directly from restaurant brand. 2. Delivery Partner Integration connects to DoorDash Drive, Uber Direct for fulfillment only (10-15% fee vs 25-35%). 3. Customer Data Capture builds owned database: email, phone, preferences, order history. 4. Loyalty Integration awards points and offers for first-party orders (incentivize direct ordering). 5. Smart Routing selects optimal delivery partner based on availability, cost, and customer location.
dataSources: Menu and pricing (direct, not marked up)
benefits: 15-25% higher margins (10-15% delivery fee vs 25-35% marketplace)
First-party customer data enables retargeting and loyalty
Lower menu pricing (no markup needed) improves competitiveness
Consistent brand experience across all channels
40-60% of orders shift from third-party to first-party over 12 months

quickWins: Launch branded web ordering with DoorDash Drive integration
Offer 2x loyalty points for first-party orders

label: Order Ahead & Pickup
description: Scheduled ordering with curbside and in-store pickup reducing customer wait time by 70-85% and driving 25-35% increase in order frequency through convenience.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer calls restaurant to place order for pickup (phone line often busy). 2. Order taken manually with potential errors. 3. Customer told 'it'll be ready in 15 minutes' with no precision. 4. Customer arrives and waits in line to pick up and pay. 5. Order may not be ready or was prepared too early (cold food).
constraints: Phone ordering inefficient (busy signals, manual entry)
Imprecise timing leads to cold food or customer waiting
Customer must queue to pick up and pay
No visibility into order status
Staff distracted by phone orders during peak
Payment at pickup creates bottleneck

agentic.workflow: 1. Order Scheduling Agent allows customer to schedule pickup time: 'Order now for 6:30pm pickup' or 'ASAP in 12 minutes'. 2. Kitchen Timing Agent optimizes preparation start time to ensure food ready exactly at scheduled pickup. 3. Arrival Detection uses geofencing or 'I'm here' button to alert staff when customer arrives. 4. Curbside Coordination Agent sends staff out with order within 90 seconds of customer arrival. 5. Pre-Payment ensures zero waiting - customer grabs order and goes.
dataSources: Customer order and scheduled pickup time
Store layout and curbside parking spots
benefits: 70-85% reduction in customer wait time (2-3 min vs 8-15 min)
25-35% increase in order frequency (convenience drives usage)

quickWins: Launch ASAP pickup with 12-15 min time estimates
Add geofencing for 'I'm 5 min away' alerts

label: Menu Personalization & Recommendations
description: AI-driven menu recommendations based on preferences and history increasing average order value 15-30% and customer satisfaction through relevant personalized suggestions.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer views generic menu board with 50+ items. 2. Customer overwhelmed by choices, defaults to usual order. 3. No recommendations based on time of day, preferences, or dietary needs. 4. Customer unaware of new items or limited-time offers. 5. Missed upsell opportunities (customer would have added drink if suggested).
constraints: Static menu same for all customers regardless of preferences
Choice overload leads to default orders (no exploration)
New items buried in menu (low trial rate)
No time-based recommendations (breakfast items shown at dinner)
Dietary needs not accommodated (vegetarians see meat-heavy menu)
15-25% of customers would order more if prompted

agentic.workflow: 1. Personalization Engine analyzes customer: frequent breakfast visitor at 7am gets 'Your usual? Coffee + Egg McMuffin' at top of menu. 2. Dietary Filter automatically surfaces vegetarian options for known vegetarian customer. 3. Recommendation Agent suggests items: 'Try our new Spicy Chicken Sandwich (similar to your favorite Crispy Chicken)'. 4. Contextual Offers present relevant upsells: ordering sandwich triggers 'Add fries and drink for $3?'. 5. Limited-Time Promotion highlights new items customer hasn't tried yet.
dataSources: Time of day and day of week patterns
benefits: 15-30% increase in average order value through personalized upsell
25-40% new item trial rate vs 5-10% traditional
Higher customer satisfaction (relevant menu, less overwhelm)

quickWins: Implement one-tap reorder of last 3 orders
Add 'Recommended for You' section based on order history

label: Nutritional Information & Allergen Filtering
description: Real-time nutritional data with allergen alerts and dietary filtering preventing 95%+ of allergen incidents and enabling health-conscious ordering with transparency.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer with peanut allergy asks counter staff about allergens. 2. Staff checks binder or calls manager (2-3 min delay). 3. Information may be outdated or incomplete. 4. Customer guesses safe items, risks allergic reaction. 5. No calorie visibility for health-conscious customers.
constraints: Allergen information not readily accessible
Staff knowledge inconsistent or outdated
Customer anxiety about allergen safety
2-5% allergen incident rate due to poor information
No nutritional transparency (calorie, protein, sodium)
Health-conscious customers avoid QSR due to lack of data

agentic.workflow: 1. Allergen Profile Agent prompts customer to set dietary restrictions: peanuts, gluten, dairy, shellfish. 2. Menu Filtering automatically removes or flags unsafe items with clear warnings. 3. Nutritional Display shows calories, protein, carbs, sodium for every item and customization. 4. Safe Customization suggests modifications: 'Remove sauce to make this gluten-free'. 5. Alert System warns at checkout: 'Attention: Your order contains dairy (your listed allergen)' with confirmation required.
dataSources: Nutritional information per item and modifier
benefits: 95%+ reduction in allergen incidents through proactive filtering and alerts

hitlGate.policy: Require explicit customer confirmation and acknowledgment before allowing order submission

quickWins: Add calorie counts to all menu items
Implement allergen filter toggle for top 8 allergens

label: Order Modification & Reordering
description: Seamless order editing and one-tap reordering reducing friction by 60-80% and increasing repeat order frequency 40-60% through convenience and saved preferences.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer places order, then realizes they forgot to add extra sauce. 2. Customer must cancel entire order and start over. 3. For repeat orders, customer must manually browse menu and rebuild order from scratch. 4. Frequent customers order same meal weekly but re-enter every time. 5. No order history or saved favorites.
constraints: Can't modify order after submission (must cancel and restart)
No order history to reference past orders
No saved favorites or quick reorder
Repeat customers waste time rebuilding same order
Forgotten items require new order or counter visit
Poor experience drives customers to competitors with better features

agentic.workflow: 1. Order Modification Agent allows editing before kitchen prep starts: 'Add extra sauce' or 'Change drink to Diet Coke'. 2. Order History maintains last 20 orders with full customization details. 3. One-Tap Reorder enables instant ordering of past meals: 'Order your usual? Big Mac meal, no pickles, extra Mac sauce'. 4. Favorite Save allows customer to name and save custom orders: 'My Lunch' or 'Kids Meal Friday'. 5. Family Orders save multi-person orders for quick reordering.
dataSources: Customer order history with full customizations
benefits: 60-80% reduction in order friction through modification and reorder
40-60% increase in repeat order frequency (convenience drives usage)
One-tap reorder completes in <30 seconds vs 3-5 min manual

quickWins: Implement order history with one-tap reorder
Allow modifications within 5-min window after submission
